ygData.subject: RE: Shin Gauntlets and Greaves
ygData.msgSnippet: hehe, the shin armor is easy to get usually, other night i was there with a group in the bedroom and we had 2 shins with pants on the ground dead. we auctioned
ygData.messageBody:
hehe, the shin armor is easy to get usually, other night i was there with a
group in the bedroom and we had 2 shins with pants on the ground dead. we
auctioned them to anyone needing them, then someone auctioned one in the
hallways, then another auctioned one right at the zone, you just got a bad
night, if people hunt the corridors or the zone, you will have a harder time
to get the items.

Minkin 36 bard
Razan 39 SK
Sol Ro

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Kimes, Dean W. [SMTP:Dean_Kimes@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, December 01, 1999 2:47 PM
> To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Shin Gauntlets and Greaves
>
> From: "Kimes, Dean W." <Dean_Kimes@...>
>
> Yes, a bad night probably. I also try advertising I am looking for the
> items. That's how I got the first one, I advertised I had non-summoned
> food
> and a monk immediately came up and killed the Shin knights until I got
> what
> I needed for 20 muffins and 20 milk. He got no xp for the Shin but was
> happy to get the real food without running to Freeport. a simple /auction
> "looking for shin greaves/gauntlets that no one wants" will often get the
> response "Will hunt for food, <grin>"
>
> Kitasi
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: scott@... [mailto:scott@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, December 01, 1999 12:40 PM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] Shin Gauntlets and Greaves
>
>
> From: scott@... (scott brisko)
>
> I believe they are live froggies that got stuck with the bad job of having
> to hang out on the dead side.
>
> Anyway...
>
> Having read all the posts recently about getting cool stuff down in Guk, I
> made my way there using an assortment of maps and directions and finally
> found the entrance everyone's been talking about. Sure enough the floor
> was
> littered with the corpses of dead players, but no dead Shin Knight
> corpses.
>
> I am a patient bard, as well as one that was invis and feeling quite safe,
> so I sat down and waited for the dreaded trains to come bringing piles of
> loot.
>
> 5 minutes, 10 minutes, 15 minutes... hmmm no trains.
>
> At that point I got up and walked down to where the north-south hall
> starts.. "Ah a dead froggie!" I loot and get some gold, but nothing else.
> While I am looting another Shin Knight spawns and takes no notice of me
> while I am invis or visible. I tell a friend who is familiar with Guk
> asking
> him if I am indeed in the right spot and if people really do train stuff
> here. He confirms on both issues, so I head back to zone border and wait.
>
> 5 minutes, 10 minutes, 15 minutes... hmmm no trains.
>
> I do a "/who" and see that indeed there are many people here, over 60 at
> that point. I also realize that I am the only player here under level 30.
> A
> small shiver overtakes me.
>
> I start to wander down to the north-south hall again, two Shin Knights are
> now there but no one is taking them on. I decide to head south towards the
> river/stream to see if anyone has left something down there. I turn the
> first corner to start heading east/south east when I see a dead froggie.
> At
> first he does nothing to me, so I "/con" him and it says he's ready to
> attack, and to boot he's close enough. Just then as I am thinking how
> fortunate I am that he's ignored me, "BAM!" he hits, no too hard, but
> since
> he was dark red to me I make my dash back and zone. I also decide once I
> have zoned that maybe I will come back another time and head back to
> Freeport.
>
>
> So my question is, did I just hit Lower Guk on a bad night, or do I just
> need to be more patient? This being a vulture stuff is hard :)
>
> Bernwyn Ablesong
> Mith Marr
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: "James Schuldes" <jgs@...>
> To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
> Sent: Wednesday, December 01, 1999 11:10 AM
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Shin Gauntlets and Greaves
>
>
> > From: James Schuldes <jgs@...>
> >
> > Yes, I guess that they are "live" froggies - but my froggie faction is
> long
> > gone and they agro me. Unless I fade a little (invis to undead) then
> they
> > do not agro as I go by - I don't stand around waiting though. So, I
> guessed
> > that they were un-dead since they dint agro when I was
> invised-to-undead.
> > Live, ded, unded? 3 distinct categories?
> >
> > Sylly
> >
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Kimes, Dean W. [mailto:Dean_Kimes@...]
> > Sent: Tuesday, November 30, 1999 3:45 PM

> > Subject: RE: [eqbards] Shin Gauntlets and Greaves
> >
> > From: "Kimes, Dean W." <Dean_Kimes@...>
> >
> > The regular Shin Knight Frogs are live. They totally ignore
> > me when I stand
> > right in front of them totally visible. Shin Ghouls on the
> > other hand make
> > me run like a cry baby the instant they smell me.
> >
> > Kitasi
> > Friend of frogloks, well ok not friend, just not
> > hated enuf to be
> > killed
> >
> >

> lol@...
> with the subject submissions.
